title: Melbourne motorist with fake number plates caught out due to spelling mistake
text:
A motorist with a fake number plate has been caught out after a spelling error was spotted by police.

The obviously fake number plate on a Holden Berlina was seen by police in Wyndham, south-west Melbourne on Friday.

'Victoria - the edgucation state,' the plate read.

A motorist with a fake number plate (pictured) has been caught out after a spelling error was spotted by police

A picture of the number plate was shared to Facebook by Wyndham police, mocking the driver's spelling skills

A picture of the number plate was shared to Facebook by Wyndham police, who mocked the driver's spelling skills.

'Criminal mastermind... not quite!' the post read.

'We gave him an 8/10 for his colouring in skills, a 2/10 for his spelling ability and an additional charge for court.

Social media users also trolled the driver over the fake plate.

'Well that plate really sums up the state of our education system in Victoria,' one person wrote.

'That's priceless!' wrote another.

'This bloke needs an edgucation,' another said.
description: The obviously fake number plate on a Holden Berlina was seen by police in Wyndham, south-west Melbourne on Friday.
authors: Kelsey Wilkie For Daily Mail Australia
